intro: Lactuca armena, commonly known as Armenian lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the dandelion family, Asteraceae. It is native to the Caucasus region and parts of southern Europe, often found in rocky or arid environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are yellow and produce small, winged seeds that are dispersed by the wind. The plant has a long history of use in herbal remedies for its purported anti-inflammatory and digestive properties.
